titlealts.searchtitle: create or update pre-shared key file

section.title: Purpose
section.p: Uploads a pre-shared key file to . A pre-shared key (PSK) is a secret key that can be shared between two devices (for example, a client and a server) that are connected by a secured channel. The PSK is used by the server to authenticate the client.

section.title: URI
section.p: Use the REST API PUT method with the following file URI:

ul.li: If you apply a new PSK file, the existing PSK file is overwritten without warning.
You cannot view the contents of the PreSharedKey file by using a REST API. To view the contents of the PSK file, you must manually retrieve the file from the filesystem.
The supported file format of a pre-shared key file is CSV.

refbody.section: ExampleUpload a pre-shared key file called "MyPreSharedKeyFile.csv" and save it as "myPSKfile_201603016.csv" by using cURL:curl -X PUT -T /var/tmp/MyPreSharedKeyFile.csv http://127.0.0.1:9089/ima/v1/file/myPSKfile_201603016.csvÂ An example response: { "Version": "v1", "Code": "CWLNA6011", "Message": "The requested configuration change has completed successfully." }
